conclusion: A approaches the scattered blocks from the right side at a shallow angle.
The blue block directly ahead of A (lower-right of the cluster) is the first object in its path.
Because that blue block is small and light, A pushes it sideways rather than coming to an immediate stop, losing only a little speed.
After that deflection, Aâ€™s path shifts slightly leftward and upward, sending it into the nearby orange block that is just above and to the left of the first blue block.
When A hits the orange block, the car transfers more momentum, slows sharply, and the block slides forward a short distance.
The loss of speed from the second impact is enough that A no longer has the power to reach any of the larger central blocks.
A finally stops just behind (to the right of) the orange block it last struck, roughly in the lower-middle portion of the scene.
A collides first with the small blue block, then with the adjacent orange block, and comes to rest immediately after the second impact, short of the larger cube cluster in the center.
